decision_conditions: 1.  The consent shall expire after 5 years from the date of this notice.

2.  Any advertisements displayed, and any site used for the display of advertisements, shall be maintained in a clean and tidy condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
3.  Any structure or hoarding erected or used principally for the purpose of displaying advertisements shall be maintained in a safe condition.
4.  Where an advertisement is required under these Regulations to be removed, the removal shall be carried out to the reasonable satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
5.  No advertisement is to be displayed without the permission of the owner of the site or any other person with an interest in the site entitled to grant permission.

6.  No advertisement shall be sited or displayed so as to obscure, or hinder the ready interpretation of, any road traffic sign, railway signal or aid to navigation by water or air, or so as otherwise to render hazardous the use of any highway, waterway (including any coastal waters) or aerodrome (civil or military).

Note: These are imposed automatically unless expressly varied, for instance the time limit shortened. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and plans: 20035-GAA-XX-ZZ-DR-T-0101 P03.04 (SITE LOCATION PLAN); 20035-GAA-ZZ-ZZ-DR-T-0102 P02.02 (PROPOSED LOCATION PLAN); 20035-GAA-A2-ZZ-DR-T-2102 P02.07 (EXISTING ELEVATIONS); 20035-GAA-A1-ZZ-DR-T-2101 P06 (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS); 20035-GAA-A2-ZZ-DR-T-2102 P04.04 (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS); 20035-GAA-ZZ-XX-DA-T-0001 P03 (DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT); JCH01606 V2 (HERITAGE STATEMENT)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The flag advertisement hereby approved shall be displayed no higher than 9.3m from ground level. The ground level is the surface of the ground immediately adjacent to the flag pole.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory design and to comply with the NPPF (2023), Policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), Policy DAA of the Ealing Local Plan (Reg 19) (2024) and the Generic Management Plan for Conservation Areas (2023).

| The maximum illumination of the advertisements shall comply with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in their Professional Lighting Guide "PLG05 2023 "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements including Digital Displays", including the following operational features:
-	Post curfew: (11:00pm-07:00am): display off or level reduced to 50% of pre-curfew level.
-	Daytime level: to be set according to Table 10.5 of PLG05 2023.
Static images to be displayed only (no moving or flashing images).
Vertical illuminance of sensitive facades shall not exceed the recommendations for Environmental Zone 3 of the ILP' Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light'
Reason: To comply with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Part-retrospective installation of illuminated and non-illuminated wall mounted signs, and flag advertisements (Advertisement Consent)
